account.externalId.description: Sets the account used for payments already deposited. Required when undepFunds is set to FALSE.
account.externalId.name: account.externalId

account.internalId.description: Sets the account used for payments already deposited. Required when undepFunds is set to FALSE.
account.internalId.name: account.internalId

account.name.description: Sets the account used for payments already deposited. Required when undepFunds is set to FALSE.
account.name.name: account.name

applied.description: A read-only field that returns the total of payments applied.
applied.name: applied

arAcct.externalId.description: Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.Click —New — to set up a new account.
arAcct.externalId.name: arAcct.externalId

arAcct.internalId.description: Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.Click —New — to set up a new account.
arAcct.internalId.name: arAcct.internalId

arAcct.name.description: Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.Click —New — to set up a new account.
arAcct.name.name: arAcct.name

authCode.description: Sets the authorization code for the transaction.If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field autofills with the authorization code as soon as the charge is approved.If you do not have a NetSuite merchant account, enter the authorization code you receive when the charge to the customer's credit card is validated outside of NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.
authCode.name: authCode

autoApply.description: If set to TRUE, payments are automatically applied to the oldest open receivable.
autoApply.name: autoApply

balance.description: A read-only field that returns the balance in the customer's account.This field is returned in an advanced search only. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field.
balance.name: balance

ccApproved.description: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.
ccApproved.name: ccApproved

ccAvsStreetMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsStreetMatch.value.name: ccAvsStreetMatch.value

ccAvsZipMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsZipMatch.value.name: ccAvsZipMatch.value

ccExpireDate.description: Sets the credit card expiration date.
ccExpireDate.name: ccExpireDate

ccIsPurchaseCardBin.description: This box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature and the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.
ccIsPurchaseCardBin.name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin

ccName.description: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.
ccName.name: ccName

ccNumber.description: Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.On a get, this value is masked.When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.
ccNumber.name: ccNumber

ccProcessAsPurchaseCard.description: This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.
ccProcessAsPurchaseCard.name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard

ccSecurityCode.description: Settable only if the Use Card Security Code for Credit Card Transactions company preference is enabled at Set Up > Accounting > Set Up Accounting.
ccSecurityCode.name: ccSecurityCode

ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. Possible values include:_Y � The security code information submitted did match._N � The security code information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support security codes.
ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.name: ccSecurityCodeMatch.value

ccStreet.description: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.
ccStreet.name: ccStreet

ccZipCode.description: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.
ccZipCode.name: ccZipCode

chargeIt.description: Check this box to make this payment by charging the credit card chosen in the Credit Card Select field.
chargeIt.name: chargeIt

checkNum.description: Sets the check number used for the payment.
checkNum.name: checkNum

creditCard.externalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.externalId.name: creditCard.externalId

creditCard.internalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.internalId.name: creditCard.internalId

creditCard.name.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.name.name: creditCard.name

creditCardProcessor.externalId.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors.
creditCardProcessor.externalId.name: creditCardProcessor.externalId

creditCardProcessor.internalId.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors.
creditCardProcessor.internalId.name: creditCardProcessor.internalId

creditCardProcessor.name.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors.
creditCardProcessor.name.name: creditCardProcessor.name

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, the currency of the customer for whom you are creating this transaction is shown here.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, select the transaction currency in which you want to accept payment. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.The currency you select filters the list of invoices to which you can apply payment, and lists of credits and deposits you can apply.If you are accepting payment through a top-level customer, you can make payments toward any invoices entered for a customer in the hierarchy as long as the invoice currency is set as a transaction currency for that top-level parent.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. You can enable or disable this feature. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab. Regardless of the number of boxes visible in your account, the purpose associated with these three features remains the same.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, the currency of the customer for whom you are creating this transaction is shown here.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, select the transaction currency in which you want to accept payment. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.The currency you select filters the list of invoices to which you can apply payment, and lists of credits and deposits you can apply.If you are accepting payment through a top-level customer, you can make payments toward any invoices entered for a customer in the hierarchy as long as the invoice currency is set as a transaction currency for that top-level parent.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. You can enable or disable this feature. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab. Regardless of the number of boxes visible in your account, the purpose associated with these three features remains the same.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, the currency of the customer for whom you are creating this transaction is shown here.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, select the transaction currency in which you want to accept payment. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.The currency you select filters the list of invoices to which you can apply payment, and lists of credits and deposits you can apply.If you are accepting payment through a top-level customer, you can make payments toward any invoices entered for a customer in the hierarchy as long as the invoice currency is set as a transaction currency for that top-level parent.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. You can enable or disable this feature. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab. Regardless of the number of boxes visible in your account, the purpose associated with these three features remains the same.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customer.externalId.description: References an exiting customer or job record. Required on Add.
customer.externalId.name: customer.externalId

customer.internalId.description: References an exiting customer or job record. Required on Add.
customer.internalId.name: customer.internalId

customer.name.description: References an exiting customer or job record. Required on Add.
customer.name.name: customer.name

debitCardIssueNo.description: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.
debitCardIssueNo.name: debitCardIssueNo

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments.
department.name.name: department.name

exchangeRate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the rate associated with the customer set in the customer field.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

ignoreAvs.description: Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check. If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match the billing address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.
ignoreAvs.name: ignoreAvs

isRecurringPayment.description: This box is checked if this payment was created for a recurring cash sale.Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.You should not check this box for standalone payments. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments.It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorizes cash sale sales orders.
isRecurringPayment.name: isRecurringPayment

location.externalId.description: This field is only settable if the Mulit-Location Inventory (MLI) feature is turned off.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: This field is only settable if the Mulit-Location Inventory (MLI) feature is turned off.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: This field is only settable if the Mulit-Location Inventory (MLI) feature is turned off.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this payment. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Accounts Receivable register that NetSuite merchants and their guest-customers can see (if given permission to log in and view their transaction history).
memo.name: memo

payment.description: Sets the total amount of payment for this customer.
payment.name: payment

paymentMethod.externalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.externalId.name: paymentMethod.externalId

paymentMethod.internalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.internalId.name: paymentMethod.internalId

paymentMethod.name.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.name.name: paymentMethod.name

pending.description: A read-only field that returns the sum of unapproved credit card payments for the customer.
pending.name: pending

pnRefNum.description: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.
pnRefNum.name: pnRefNum

postingPeriod.externalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.
postingPeriod.externalId.name: postingPeriod.externalId

postingPeriod.internalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.
postingPeriod.internalId.name: postingPeriod.internalId

postingPeriod.name.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.
postingPeriod.name.name: postingPeriod.name

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

total.description: NetSuite adds the payment amount from above plus any credits you have chosen to apply and displays the total here.
total.name: total

tranDate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: This is the document number automatically generated for the transaction by NetSuite.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: References an exiting customer or job record. Required on Add.
type.value.name: type.value

unapplied.description: A read-only field that returns the difference between amounts available to apply to payments and payments  applied.
unapplied.name: unapplied

undepFunds.description: Set to TRUE if entering a payment that will be deposited to a bank account later. If set to FALSE, set an account in the account field.
undepFunds.name: undepFunds

validFrom.description: Enter the date when this card first became valid.
validFrom.name: validFrom
